Note to Persons Answering the Local Government Questionnaire:

This questionnaire is divided into four parts:

PART I: Statute Labour Districts and Local Improvement Districts before 1958.

PART II: Rural-Township Local Improvement Districts and Rural Municipalities after 1958.

PART III: Villages and Cities.

PART IV: Towns and Cities.

You may answer the parts dealing with the types of local government in any order. If you have lived in more than one type of local government, you should answer each part separately.

Some of the questions are repeated in more than one part. In such cases, the question will be answered in relation to the particular question in which it appears. You need not answer the same question twice.

Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

PART II: LOCAL LABOUR DISTRICTS AND LOCAL REPRESENTATIVE DISTRICTS

1. In which of these (and during what years) did you serve?

2. If you served in the organization of districts was it voluntary basis, still whether they were popular or unpopular for what reason?

3. Was the decision to take them compulsory popular with the residents?

4. What arguments were used to justify the compulsory?

5. What objections to compulsory were raised?

6. How many meetings attended?
   - What took place, and what was the order of business?
   - Was there much discussion or argument? On what subjects?

7. Observer:
   - Was there much competition for this position?
   - What was the regular occupation of the observer?
   - Was he connected officially?
   - Was he given a free hand in exercising district affairs?
   - Did he do much of the work himself?

8. Activities:
   - What were considered the most important activities of the district (list in order of importance)?
   - Was there general agreement that these activities be carried out?
   - What expenses did the district incur?
   - Was it ever intended to distribute?
   - If so, did this cause any difficulties?
PAGE 1: ELECTIVE LABOUR DISPUTES AND LOCAL JUDGEMENTS IN THE VILLAGE.

1. In which of these local disputes did you take part?

2. If you remember when the organization of elections was held, what was the result? (Yes or No)

3. Were the elections held in secret? (Yes or No)

4. Were the elections held in public? (Yes or No)

5. What objections to the composition were raised?

6. How many meetings attended?
   - What took place, and what was the order of business?
   - Was there any discussion or argument? (Yes or No)

7. Overall:
   - Was there much competition for the position?
   - What was the regular composition of the overseers?
   - Was the composition satisfactory?
   - Was the election free from irregularities?
   - Did he do much of the work himself?

8. Additional:
   - What were considered the most important activities of the district? (List up to five)
   - What equipment did the district own?

9. Additional:
   - Was there any interest in the district? (Yes or No)
   - Was there any interest in the district? (Yes or No)
   - If so, did this cause any difficulties?
9. Taxes:
   - were they considered heavy?
   - were they considered fair as a means of raising funds?
   - was there any difficulty in collecting taxes?

10. Statute Labour:
    - was this popular?
    - was the labour involved efficient?
    - what arguments were given for the change?
    - was there any opposition?
    - on what grounds?

11. Four Township Statute Labour District (after 1903):
    - was the increase in size popular at first?
    - after people became accustomed to the change in size, what advantages or disadvantages did they think the four township unit had over the one township unit?

12. What were the ratepayers meetings like?

13. Was there much competition for the position of councillor?
    - Did candidates engage in "electioneering"?
    - Explain.

14. Was there a good turnout of voters for elections?

15. How frequently did council meet?

16. Describe procedure at council meetings (if you are familiar with it).

17. Were relations between the council and the secretary-treasurer usually good?

18. If not, what were the causes of difficulty?

19. What was the general opinion about the secretary-treasurer?
    - on what grounds?

20. What other persons were employed by the council?

PART II: TOWNSHIP LOCAL IMPROVEMENT DISTRICTS AND RURAL MUNICIPALITIES - Letter 1938

1. During what years did you live in a nine township L.I.D.? (Give numbers or names)

a nine township R.M.?

2. Did the people in your community like this form of organization better than the smaller units in existence before 1904?

For what reasons?

3. Describe meetings, telling how many attended, what took place at meetings, which subjects caused the most discussion, and any differences noticed from meetings of earlier years.

4. Was there much competition for election to positions of reeve and councillor?

Were they regarded as positions of some honor, or just a chore that someone had to do?

5. Were people generally satisfied with the way local affairs were managed by the reeve and council?

If not, for what reasons?

Did people think that relatives and friends of council members received special favors? If so, of what kind?
PART II: NINE-TOWNSHIP LOCAL DEPLOYMENT DISTRICTS AND RURAL MUNICIPALITIES

1. During what years did you live in a nine township L.I.D.? (Give numbers or names)

a nine township R.M.?

2. Did the people in your community like this form of organization better than the smaller units in existence before 1908?

For what reasons?

3. Describe ratepayer meetings, telling how many attended, what took place at meetings, which subjects caused the most discussion, and any differences noticed from meetings of earlier years.

4. Was there much competition for election to positions of reeve and councillor?

Were they regarded as positions of true honor, or just a "chore" that someone had to do?

5. Were people generally satisfied with the way local affairs were managed by the reeve and council?

If not, for what reasons?

Did people think that relatives and friends of council members received special favors?
6. Describe differences in activities and duties of the 9 township L.I.D.'s or R.M.'s as compared with the 4 township units before 1928?

Did people think the L.I.D. (or R.M.) should do more?

7. What equipment did the L.I.D. (or R.M.) own?

Was it loaned to individuals or kept only for municipal (or district) work?

8. Was there much complaint about the taxes levied for municipal purposes?

If so, on what grounds? (that is, because they were too heavy, or not fairly distributed, etc.)

What suggestions did people have for ways of raising revenue other than taxes on land?

9. (To be answered by those who lived in L.I.D.'s, anxious to have it formed into a R.M.)

Were people in the L.I.D., anxious to have it formed into a R.M.?

Why or why not?

10. Was it customary to permit a person to work off his taxes by cutting brush on the road allowances or by roadwork with team and scraper?

Can you remember during what years this was allowed?

My "no" why?

Can you remember during what years this was allowed?
PART III: VILLAGE

1. In what villages (and during what years) have you lived?

2. Do you recall the formation of the village? If so, was there much excitement among the people over its formation or any particular notice given to this event?

3. If you lived in a P.M., or L.T.D., before moving to the village, what differences did you notice in the management of village affairs?

4. Was there much competition for the position of councillor?
   - Was there usually a good turnout of voters for election of councillors?
   - Was it generally considered that the council did a good job?

5. Was there any custom followed in the selection of overseer by council members (i.e., by rotation etc.)?

In the conduct of village affairs, how did the importance of the overseer compare with that of the other councillors?

6. What were the most important activities of the village council?
   (List in order of importance).

7. Did property owners in the village think they were treated unfairly compared with people living in the surrounding district and making use of village facilities?

Describe any efforts made in the village for the adoption of the single tax.

How successful were these efforts?

8. Has there ever been much agitation or desire to have the village established as a town?

10. Describe any efforts made in the Village for the adoption of the single tax.

11. How successful were these efforts?

PART IV: TOWNS AND CITIES.

1. In what towns or cities (and during what years) have you lived?

2. If you remember its establishment as a town (or city), tell what you recall of any special notices given to the event.

3. What differences in the management of local affairs did you notice particularly compared with where you had lived previously?

4. Was there much competition for the position of mayor?

5. What differences have you noticed in the services performed by the town (or city) recently as compared with earlier years?

Do you think the changes are an improvement, or not?

6. Has there ever been much complaint from property owners in the town (or city) that they were taxed unfairly compared with people living in the surrounding district and making use of town (or city) facilities?

Describe any efforts made for the adoption of the single tax.

How successful were these efforts?
